cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi SSE of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: Very slowly north-northwest today, turning north then northeast and tracking inland across Alabama and Georgia toward the Carolinas late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Alabama/Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of Pearl River to east of Navarre FL. Tropical Storm Watch: none for Georgia coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: East of Mouth of Pearl River to Navarre FL. Tropical Storm Warning: East of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL; Pearl River westward to Grand Isle LA including New Orleans area. Storm Surge Warning: Mouth of Mississippi River to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL including Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact along the northern Gulf Coast (southeast LA, MS, AL, western FL Panhandle) with inland impacts spreading across AL, GA and the Carolinas.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions 25–35 mph possible Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the Georgia coast; minor water level rises <3 ft possible during onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated higher totals possible as the remnant circulation passes nearby Thursday night–Friday, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated short-lived tornadoes cannot be ruled out on the southeastern side of the remnant system as it crosses Georgia.
